dkeep.logic.levels

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.levels.Level
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InitialLevel, KeepLevel

    public abstract class Level
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents the different levels that constitute a dungeon. All the game flow and handling will occur here.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Level.LEVEL_STATE
      All the possible level states.

      • Level

        public Level()
        Default constructor

    • Method Detail

      • getRandomEmptyPositions

        public Pair getRandomEmptyPositions()
        Finds a random empty position in the map that's not adjacent to the hero. Useful for placing randomly ogres in the map.
        Returns:
        A pair containing the empty position

      • findPassageDoors

        public void findPassageDoors()
        Finds the passage Doors of a level. By passage doors we mean the doors adjacent to the edges of the map.

      • resetGameElements

        public abstract void resetGameElements()
        Reset keep level elements to original

      • findGameElements

        public abstract void findGameElements()
        Identifies the game elements on the map, generating some elements randomly if needed. Some random behaviour is needed, for example, to generate ogres.

      • createMapToPrint

        public abstract char[][] createMapToPrint()
        Creates a map with game elements to be printed
        Returns:
        map to be printed

      • updateLevel

        public abstract Level.LEVEL_STATE updateLevel(MovingObject.MOVEMENT_TYPE move)
        Level state machine, responsible for the level game flow
        Parameters:
        move - - hero movement
        Returns:
        current level state

      • collision

        public boolean collision(MovingObject A,
                         int spacing)
        Checks collision between any moving object and the hero, with a given allowed spacing between them.
        Parameters:
        A - - the moving object
        spacing - - allowed spacing between them
        Returns:
        true in case of collision, false otherwise.

      • resetElements

        public void resetElements()
        Resets the Hero back to it's original state

      • getHero

        public Hero getHero()
        Returns:
        the hero

      • setHero

        public void setHero(Hero hero)
        Parameters:
        hero - the hero to set

      • getMap

        public char[][] getMap()
        Returns:
        the level map
